body:
UPD:
running sql from https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/framework/web/migrations/schema-mssql.sql produces error:

```
Error: SQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]Column, parameter, or variable #3: Cannot find data type BLOB.
```

Still get 

`
Exception (Database Exception) 'yii\db\Exception' with message 'SQLSTATE[42000]: [Microsoft][SQL Server Native Client 11.0][SQL Server]Implicit conversion from data type nvarchar to varbinary(max) is not allowed. Use the CONVERT function to run this query. The SQL being executed was: INSERT INTO [session2] ([data], [id], [expire]) VALUES ('__flash|a:0:{}', 'trbq50v3h7fcder9pf0749e8u7', 1474890125)'
`

issue.title: Portability fixes for SchemaBuilder on MSSQL

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
Changed binary mapping to `varbinary(max)` on MSSQL instead of `binary(1)` (which requires a length and is fixed length)
to better match other dbms.

Changed timestamp mapping to datetime on MSSQL. Timestamp is a unique number on MSSQL, not a timestamp.

separated from #9191

body: The solution is to cast explicitly `CONVERT(VARBINARY, :p1)` everywhere where value is bound.

issue.title: #12599: Fixed MSSQL fail to work with `nvarbinary`. Enhanced SQL scripts compatibility with older versions

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

| Tests pass?   | yes

body: @SDKiller would you please check if it works for you if you have some time?

@samdark 

Error on calling `Yii::$app->session->set()` is gone. 

But now there is a problem with getting values from session with `get()`. 
Data is empty - but `data` column is not empty.

Maybe it is a separate issue with session handler on windows server and converting data back from binary type?

Switched back to session table with `text` type for `data` column - at least it was working.
